title: How to Delete Snapchat Messages Another User Saved: 6 Steps

steps.title: Open the Snapchat app on your mobile device.
steps.content: Open the Snapchat app on your mobile device. This is the white ghost with a yellow background. Snapchat is available for iOS in the App Store and for Android in the Google Play Store . [1] X Research source If you aren't already logged in, tap Sign in to do so now, or create an account . This method may not always work if a user has a faulty internet connection or has an old version of Snapchat. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the Chat icon.
steps.content: Tap the Chat icon. This is the text box icon on the bottom toolbar, to the left of the camera. You'll see a list of all your recently messaged friends.

steps.title: Tap a conversation.
steps.content: Tap a conversation. You'll be able to see a list of your recent and pinned conversations.

steps.title: Tap and hold the Snap or chat message you want to delete.
steps.content: Tap and hold the Snap or chat message you want to delete. A pop-up menu will open. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Delete.
steps.content: Tap Delete . This will be next to a trash can icon. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Delete.
steps.content: Tap Delete . The Snap or chat message will be deleted from the conversation. The other user will see "(You) deleted a Snap" in the chat log. [5] X Research source This is how you can delete saved messages . If the user has their chats set to delete After Viewing , the deleted saved message will disappear once they navigate away from the chat screen. However, if they have it set to 24 Hours after Viewing , you may need to wait 24 hours until the saved message is fully deleted. [6] X Research source This may give the user extra time to screenshot a Snapchat .
